meanings.definition: (Latin) to injure, hurt, wound; to strike, hit; to offend, annoy
meanings.english_definition: (Latin) to injure, hurt, wound; to strike, hit; to offend, annoy

etymology.value: From Proto-Italic *laidō, from Proto-Indo-European *h₂léydʰeti (“to strike, injure”).

verb_forms.present_active_indicative: laedō, laedis, laedit, laedimus, laeditis, laedunt
verb_forms.imperfect_active_indicative: laedēbam, laedēbās, laedēbat, laedēbāmus, laedēbātis, laedēbant
verb_forms.future_active_indicative: laedam, laedēs, laedet, laedēmus, laedētis, laedent
verb_forms.perfect_active_indicative: laesī, laesistī, laesit, laesimus, laesistis, laesērunt
verb_forms.pluperfect_active_indicative: laeseram, laeserās, laeserat, laeserāmus, laeserātis, laeserant
verb_forms.future_perfect_active_indicative: laeserō, laeseris, laeserit, laeserimus, laeseritis, laeserint
